posts.name: ATEMS Robotics
posts.cooked: So I am my teams programmer, and I have been trying to use magic motion or PID to move an intake arm to a specific position, but it keeps not moving the motor at all. Can I get some help? This is the GitHub: GitHub - ATEMS-Robotics/2025ReefScapeCode-Team10062: This is our teams code for the 2025 season.

link_counts.title: GitHub - ATEMS-Robotics/2025ReefScapeCode-Team10062: This is our teams code for the 2025 season.

posts.name: Benjamin Hall
posts.cooked: I don’t see the device PID gains configured anywhere. Check out our Motion Magic® documentation to get an idea of how to set everything up in code.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.custom_user_title: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.name: ATEMS Robotics
posts.cooked: I’ll try, thank you, but I’m not sure if I understand how to set it up, or where to? Do I need to make a new file?

posts.name: Benjamin Hall
posts.cooked: The configuration code (the first code block) would typically go in your subsystem constructor. The control object would be instantiated as a class member variable of your Subsystem (as you’re already doing), and the setControl() call would be called periodically, such as in a Command.

posts.name: Emre
posts.cooked:
No just follow docs you have to write to your config image 995×447 29.7 KB (it is just example don’t give same values)
